skills.skill: Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning (HVAC) Repair

duties_responsibilities.duty: Diagnose, repair, and perform preventative maintenance on commercial and industrial HVAC equipment, including large and small rooftop units, split systems, chillers, and boilers.
Perform maintenance, repair, and replacement of defective equipment, components, or wiring.
Conduct intermediate - advanced diagnostics, troubleshooting, pipefitting, and brazing of CAT I, II, and III HVAC equipment.
Educate customers on proper use of equipment, maintenance schedule, and operating manual.
Lead the rebuild and retrofit of CAT I, II and III level units, and guide less experienced technicians through hands-on demonstration.
Identify and quote opportunities for minor repairs directly to the customer and communicate potential sales opportunities to the sales staff.
Perform basic data entry, navigate the use of email, internet, and word processing programs, and analyze chiller trend data to ensure optimal performance.
Potentially travel with some overnight travel for service applications and training.

education_certification.credential: Associate degree or equivalent from two-year college or technical school, with a certificate in Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning.
Refrigeration Certification or other professional on-the-job training in the HVAC Industry.
Valid driver's license with acceptable driving record.
Any required license(s) and/or training card as required by local law district.
Ability to lift up to 50lbs with or without an accommodation.
